==Events==
* [[758]] &ndash; [[Guangzhou]] is sacked by [[Arab]] and [[Persian people|Persian]] [[pirate]]s.
*[[1137]] &ndash; [[Battle of Rignano]] between [[Ranulf of Apulia]] and [[Roger II of Sicily]].
*[[1226]] &ndash; [[Trần Thủ Độ]], head of the [[Trần Dynasty|Trần clan]] of [[Vietnam]], forces [[Lý Huệ Tông]], the last emperor of the [[Lý Dynasty]], to commit suicide.
*[[1270]] &ndash; The [[Eighth Crusade]] and siege of [[Tunis]] end by an agreement between [[Charles I of Sicily]] (brother to King [[Louis IX of France]], who had died months earlier) and the [[sultan]] of [[Tunis]].
*[[1340]] &ndash; [[Kingdom of Portugal|Portuguese]] and [[Kingdom of Castile|Castilian]] forces halt a [[Marinid dynasty|Marinid]] invasion at the [[Battle of Río Salado]].
*[[1485]] &ndash; King [[Henry VII of England]] is crowned.
*[[1501]] &ndash; [[Banquet of Chestnuts|Ballet of Chestnuts]] &ndash; a banquet held by [[Cesare Borgia]] in the Papal Palace where fifty prostitutes or courtesans are in attendance for the entertainment of the guests.
*[[1657]] &ndash; [[Spanish Empire|Spanish]] forces fail to retake [[Jamaica]] at the [[Battle of Ocho Rios (1657)|Battle of Ocho Rios]] during the [[Anglo-Spanish War (1654–60)|Anglo-Spanish War]].
*[[1806]] &ndash; Believing he is facing a much larger force, Prussian Lieutenant General Friedrich von Romberg, commanding 5,300 men, [[Capitulation of Stettin|surrendered the city of Stettin]] to 800 French soldiers commanded by [[Antoine Charles Louis de Lasalle|General Lassalle]].
*[[1831]] &ndash; In [[Southampton County, Virginia]], escaped slave [[Nat Turner]] is captured and arrested for leading the bloodiest [[Nat Turner's slave rebellion|slave rebellion]] in United States history.
*[[1863]] &ndash; Danish Prince Wilhelm arrives in [[Athens]] to assume his throne as [[George I of Greece|George I]], [[King of the Hellenes]].
*[[1864]] &ndash; [[Second Schleswig War]] ends. Denmark renounces all claim to [[Schleswig]], [[Holstein]] and [[Lauenburg]], which come under [[Prussia]]n and Austrian administration.
*  1864   &ndash; [[Helena, Montana]] is founded after four [[Prospecting|prospector]]s discover [[gold]] at "Last Chance Gulch".
*[[1888]] &ndash; [[Rudd Concession]] granted by King [[Lobengula]] of [[Matabeleland]] to agents of [[Cecil Rhodes]] led by [[Charles Rudd]].
*[[1894]] &ndash; Domenico Melegatti obtains a patent for a procedure to be applied in producing [[pandoro]] industrially.
*[[1905]] &ndash; [[Czar]] [[Nicholas II of Russia]] grants Russia's first [[constitution]], creating a legislative assembly.
*[[1918]] &ndash; The [[Ottoman Empire]] signs an [[armistice]] with the [[Allies of World War I|Allies]], ending the [[World War I|First World War]] in the Middle East.
*[[1920]] &ndash; The [[Communist Party of Australia]] is founded in Sydney.
*[[1922]] &ndash; [[Benito Mussolini]] is made [[Italian Prime Minister|Prime Minister]] of Italy.
*[[1925]] &ndash; [[John Logie Baird]] creates Britain's first [[television transmitter]].
*[[1929]] &ndash; The [[Standseilbahn Stuttgart|Stuttgart Cable Car]] is constructed in [[Stuttgart]], Germany.
*[[1938]] &ndash; [[Orson Welles]] broadcasts his radio play of [[H. G. Wells]]'s ''[[The War of the Worlds (radio drama)|The War of the Worlds]]'', causing anxiety in some of the audience in the United States.
*[[1941]] &ndash; [[World War II]]: [[Franklin Delano Roosevelt]] approves U.S. $1 billion in [[Lend-Lease]] aid to the [[Allies of World War II|Allied nations]].
*  1941   &ndash; 1,500 [[Jews]] from [[Pidhaytsi]] (in western [[Ukraine]]) are sent by [[Nazis]] to [[Belzec extermination camp]].
*[[1942]] &ndash; Lt. [[Tony Fasson]], Able Seaman [[Colin Grazier]] and canteen assistant [[Tommy Brown (GM)|Tommy Brown]] from {{HMS|Petard|G56|6}} board [[German submarine U-559|''U-559'']], retrieving material which would lead to the decryption of the German [[Enigma code]].
*[[1944]] &ndash; [[Anne Frank]] and sister [[Margot Frank]] are deported from [[Auschwitz concentration camp|Auschwitz]] to the [[Bergen-Belsen concentration camp]].
*[[1945]] &ndash; [[Jackie Robinson]] of the [[Kansas City Monarchs]] signs a contract for the [[Los Angeles Dodgers|Brooklyn Dodgers]] to break the [[baseball color barrier]].
*[[1947]] &ndash; The [[General Agreement on Tariffs and Trade]] (GATT), which is the foundation of the [[World Trade Organisation]] (WTO), is founded.
*[[1950]] &ndash; [[Pope Pius XII]] witnesses the "[[Miracle of the Sun]]" while at the [[Vatican City|Vatican]].
*[[1953]] &ndash; [[Cold War]]: U.S. President [[Dwight D. Eisenhower]] formally approves the [[top secret]] document National Security Council Paper No. 162/2, which states that the United States' arsenal of [[nuclear weapon]]s must be maintained and expanded to counter the [[communism|communist]] threat.
*[[1960]] &ndash; [[Michael Woodruff]] performs the first successful [[kidney transplant]] in the United Kingdom at the [[Edinburgh Royal Infirmary]].
*[[1961]] &ndash; [[Nuclear testing]]: The [[Soviet Union]] detonates the [[hydrogen bomb]] [[Tsar Bomba]] over [[Novaya Zemlya]]; at 50 megatons of yield, it is still the largest explosive device ever detonated, nuclear or otherwise.
*  1961   &ndash; Because of "violations of [[Lenin]]'s precepts", it is decreed that [[Joseph Stalin]]'s body be removed from its place of honour inside Lenin's tomb and buried near [[the Kremlin]] wall with a plain granite marker instead.
*[[1965]] &ndash; [[Vietnam War]]: Just miles from [[Da Nang]], [[United States Marines]] repel an intense attack by wave after wave of [[Viet Cong]] forces, killing 56 guerrillas. 
*[[1970]] &ndash; In [[Vietnam]], the worst [[monsoon]] to hit the area in six years causes large [[flood]]s, kills 293, leaves 200,000 homeless and virtually halts the [[Vietnam War]].
*[[1972]] &ndash; A collision between two commuter trains in [[Chicago]] kills 45 and injures 332.
*[[1973]] &ndash; The [[Bosphorus Bridge]] in [[Istanbul]], Turkey is completed, connecting the continents of Europe and Asia over the [[Bosphorus]] for the second time.
*[[1974]] &ndash; [[The Rumble in the Jungle]] boxing match between [[Muhammad Ali]] and [[George Foreman]] takes place in [[Kinshasa]], [[Zaire]].
*[[1975]] &ndash; [[Juan Carlos of Spain|Prince Juan Carlos]] becomes Spain's acting head of state, taking over for the country's ailing dictator, Gen. [[Francisco Franco]].
*[[1980]] &ndash; [[El Salvador]] and [[Honduras]] sign a peace treaty to put the border dispute fought over in [[1969]]'s [[Football War]] before the [[International Court of Justice]].
*[[1983]] &ndash; The first democratic elections in [[Argentina]] after seven years of military rule are held.
*[[1985]] &ndash; [[Space Shuttle Challenger]] lifts off for mission [[STS-61-A]], its final successful mission.
*[[1987]] &ndash; In Japan, [[NEC]] releases the first [[History of video game consoles (fourth generation)|16-bit (fourth generation) video game console]], the [[PC Engine]], which is later sold in other markets under the name [[TurboGrafx-16]].
*[[1991]] &ndash; The [[Madrid Conference of 1991|Madrid Conference]] for Middle East peace talks opens.
*[[1993]] &ndash; [[The Troubles]]: The [[Ulster Defence Association]], an [[Ulster loyalism|Ulster loyalist]] paramilitary, [[Greysteel massacre|carry out a mass shooting]] at a [[Halloween]] party in [[Greysteel]], [[Northern Ireland]]. Eight civilians are murdered and thirteen wounded.
*[[1995]] &ndash; [[Quebec]] citizens narrowly vote (50.58% to 49.42%) to remain a province of [[Canada]] in their [[Quebec referendum, 1995|second referendum]] on national sovereignty.
*[[2005]] &ndash; The rebuilt [[Dresden Frauenkirche]] (destroyed in the [[bombing of Dresden in World War II|firebombing of Dresden]] during World War II) is reconsecrated after a thirteen-year rebuilding project.
